threadSupport.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* Thread support for ROSE */
00002 #ifndef ROSE_threadSupport_H
00003 #define ROSE_threadSupport_H
00004 
00005 /* Design rules:
00006  *   1. All public symbols in this file should use the "RTS_" prefix (ROSE Thread Support).
00007  *
00008  *   2. All constructs that have a user-supplied compound statement as a "body", have a matching "_END" macro.  For instance,
00009  *      RTS_MUTEX starts a mutual exclusion for a critical section, which ends with an RTS_MUTEX_END macro.  The END macros
00010  *      generally take no arguments.
00011  *
00012  *   3. Locally scoped symbols defined by the macros have names beginning with "RTS_". This is generally followed by the first
00013  *      letter of the rest of the macro name, a letter "s" or "p" for "shared" or "private", and an underscore.  For example,
00014  *      within the RTS_MUTEX macros, a private (non-shared) variable might be named "RTS_Mp_mutex".
00015  *
00016  *   4. Constructs that allow a user-supplied compound statement as a "body" should allow the body to "break" or "throw". Both
00017  *      forms of premature exit should behave as if the body executed to completion (except throw will throw the exception
00018  *      again automatically).
00019  *
00020  *   5. New functionality shall have types, constants, and functions reminiscent of the POSIX threads interface, but whose
00021  *      names begin with "RTS_" rather than "pthread_".
00022  */
00023 
00024 /* Needed for ROSE_HAVE_PTHREAD_H definition */
00025 #include "rosePublicConfig.h"
00026 
00027 #include <assert.h>
00028 #include <stdint.h>
00029 #include <stdio.h>
00030 #include <stdlib.h>

00034 /* Figure out whether ROSE can support multi-threading and what kind of support library is available. */
00035 #ifdef ROSE_HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00036 #  define ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00037 #  define ROSE_THREADS_POSIX
00038 #  include <pthread.h>
00039 #else
00040 #  undef  ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 /* This warning is in a public header file so that end users will see it when they compile against a version of ROSE that
00044  * doesn't have multi-thread support.  It would be imprudent to move this to one of the library's *.C files because then
00045  * an end user might spend substantial time trying to figure out why his multi-threaded program fails nondeterministically when
00046  * the ROSE documentation advertises that certain functions are thread safe.
00047  *
00048  * Unfortunately, due to the way ROSE's header files are organized, threadSupport.h will be included by pretty much every
00049  * ROSE library source file because every file includes _all_ the Sage node definitions (instead of only the ones it needs),
00050  * and a few of those nodes (e.g., SgFile) depend on something defined by the Disassembler class. The Disassembler supports
00051  * multi threading and therefore includes this header. Therefore every ROSE library source file will spit out this warning. */
00052 #ifndef ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00053 #  ifdef _MSC_VER
00054 #    pragma message("Multi-thread support is not enabled. ROSE will not be thread safe even for functions that advertise safety.")
00055 #  else
00056 #    warning "Multi-thread support is not enabled. ROSE will not be thread safe even for functions that advertise safety."
00057 #  endif
00058 #endif
00059

00087 enum RTS_Layer {
00088     RTS_LAYER_DONTCARE = 0,
00089 
00090     /* ROSE library layers, 100-199 */
00091     RTS_LAYER_ROSE_CALLBACKS_LIST_OBJ   = 100,          
00092     RTS_LAYER_RTS_MESSAGE_CLASS         = 105,          
00093     RTS_LAYER_DISASSEMBLER_CLASS        = 110,          
00094     RTS_LAYER_ROSE_SMT_SOLVERS          = 115,          
00096     /* Simulator layers (see projects/simulator), 200-220
00097      *
00098      * Constraints:
00099      *     RSIM_PROCESS_OBJ        < RSIM_PROCESS_CLONE_OBJ
00100      *     RSIM_SIGNALHANDLING_OBJ < RSIM_PROCESS_OBJ
00101      */
00102     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_SIGNALHANDLING_OBJ   = 200,          
00103     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_PROCESS_OBJ          = 201,          
00104     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_PROCESS_CLONE_OBJ    = 202,          
00105     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_THREAD_OBJ           = 203,          
00106     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_THREAD_CLASS         = 204,          
00107     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_SYSCALLDISABLER_OBJ  = 205,          
00108     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_TRACEIO_OBJ          = 206,          
00109     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_SIMULATOR_CLASS      = 207,          
00110     RTS_LAYER_RSIM_SIMULATOR_OBJ        = 208,          
00112     /* User layers.  These are for people that might want to use the ROSE Thread Support outside ROSE, such as in ROSE
00113      * projects.   We leave it up to them to organize how they'll use the available layers. */
00114     RTS_LAYER_USER_MIN                  = 250,          
00115     RTS_LAYER_USER_MAX                  = 299,          
00117     /* Max number of layers (i.e., 0 through N-1) */
00118     RTS_LAYER_NLAYERS                   = 300
00119 };

00133 /******************************************************************************************************************************
00134  *                                      Paired macros for using mutual exclusion locks
00135  ******************************************************************************************************************************/
00136 
00156 #ifdef ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00157 #  define RTS_MUTEX(MUTEX)                                                                                                     \
00158     do {        /* standard CPP macro protection */                                                                            \
00159         RTS_mutex_t *RTS_Mp_mutex = &(MUTEX); /* saved for when we need to unlock it */                                        \
00160         int RTS_Mp_err = RTS_mutex_lock(RTS_Mp_mutex);                                                                         \
00161         assert(0==RTS_Mp_err);                                                                                                 \
00162         do {    /* so we can catch "break" statements */                                                                       \
00163             try {
00164 
00166 #  define RTS_MUTEX_END                                                                                                        \
00167             } catch (...) {                                                                                                    \
00168                 RTS_Mp_err = RTS_mutex_unlock(RTS_Mp_mutex);                                                                   \
00169                 assert(0==RTS_Mp_err);                                                                                         \
00170                 throw;                                                                                                         \
00171             }                                                                                                                  \
00172         } while (0);                                                                                                           \
00173         RTS_Mp_err = RTS_mutex_unlock(RTS_Mp_mutex);                                                                           \
00174         assert(0==RTS_Mp_err);                                                                                                 \
00175     } while (0)
00176 #else
00177 #  define RTS_MUTEX(MUTEX)                                                                                                     \
00178     do {
00179 #  define RTS_MUTEX_END                                                                                                        \
00180     } while (0)
00181 #endif

00314 #ifdef ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00315 #  define RTS_RWLOCK(RWLOCK, HOW)                                                                                              \
00316     do {        /* standard CPP macro protection */                                                                            \
00317         RTS_rwlock_t *RTS_Wp_rwlock = &(RWLOCK); /* saved for when we need to unlock it */                                     \
00318         int RTS_Wp_err = RTS_rwlock_##HOW(RTS_Wp_rwlock);                                                                      \
00319         assert(0==RTS_Wp_err);                                                                                                 \
00320         do {    /* so we can catch "break" statements */                                                                       \
00321             try {
00322                 
00323 #  define RTS_RWLOCK_END                                                                                                       \
00324             } catch (...) {                                                                                                    \
00325                 RTS_Wp_err = RTS_rwlock_unlock(RTS_Wp_rwlock);                                                                 \
00326                 assert(0==RTS_Wp_err);                                                                                         \
00327                 throw;                                                                                                         \
00328             }                                                                                                                  \
00329         } while (0);                                                                                                           \
00330         RTS_Wp_err = RTS_rwlock_unlock(RTS_Wp_rwlock);                                                                         \
00331         assert(0==RTS_Wp_err);                                                                                                 \
00332     } while (0)
00333 
00334 #else
00335 #  define RTS_RWLOCK(RWLOCK, HOW)                                                                                              \
00336     do {
00337 #  define RTS_RWLOCK_END                                                                                                       \
00338     } while (0)
00339 #endif
00340 
00341 #define RTS_READ(RWLOCK)        RTS_RWLOCK(RWLOCK, rdlock)                      
00342 #define RTS_READ_END            RTS_RWLOCK_END                                  
00343 #define RTS_WRITE(RWLOCK)       RTS_RWLOCK(RWLOCK, wrlock)                      
00344 #define RTS_WRITE_END           RTS_RWLOCK_END                                  
00346 /*******************************************************************************************************************************
00347  *                                      Types and functions for RTS_rwlock_t
00348  *
00349  * Programmers should generally use the RTS_READ and RTS_WRITE macros in their source code. The symbols defined here are
00350  * similar to pthread_rwlock* symbols and are mostly to support RTS_READ and RTS_WRITE macros (like how the RTS_mutex*
00351  * symbols support the RTS_MUTEX macro).
00352  *******************************************************************************************************************************/
00353 
00357 #ifdef ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00358 struct RTS_rwlock_t {
00359     unsigned magic;                             /* always RTS_RWLOCK_MAGIC after initialization */
00360     RTS_Layer layer;                            /* software layer to which this lock belongs, or zero */
00361     pthread_rwlock_t rwlock;                    /* the main read-write lock */
00362     RTS_mutex_t mutex;                          /* mutex to protect the following data members */
00363     size_t nlocks;                              /* number of write locks held */
00364     pthread_t owner;                            /* thread that currently holds the write lock */
00365 };
00366 #else
00367 struct RTS_rwlock_t {
00368     int dummy;
00369 };
00370 #endif
00371 
00372 #define RTS_RWLOCK_MAGIC 0x20e7f3f4
00373 
00375 #ifdef ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00376 #  define RTS_RWLOCK_INITIALIZER(LAYER) { RTS_RWLOCK_MAGIC,                                                                    \
00377                                           (LAYER),                                                                             \
00378                                           PTHREAD_RWLOCK_INITIALIZER,                                                          \
00379                                           RTS_MUTEX_INITIALIZER(RTS_LAYER_DONTCARE),                                           \
00380                                           0/*...*/                                                                             \
00381                                          }
00382 #else
00383 #  define RTS_RWLOCK_INITIALIZER(LAYER) { 0 }
00384 #endif

00441 /*******************************************************************************************************************************
00442  *                                      Paired macros for initialization functions
00443  *******************************************************************************************************************************/
00444 
00445 
00481 #ifdef ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00482 #  define RTS_INIT(MUTEX, ALLOW_RECURSION)                                                                                     \
00483     do {                                                                                                                       \
00484         static bool RTS_Is_initialized=false, RTS_Is_initializing=false;        /* "s"==shared; "p"=private */                 \
00485         static pthread_t RTS_Is_initializer;                                                                                   \
00486         static pthread_cond_t RTS_Is_condition=PTHREAD_COND_INITIALIZER;                                                       \
00487         RTS_mutex_t *RTS_Ip_mutex = &(MUTEX);                                                                                  \
00488         bool RTS_Ip_initialized, RTS_Ip_initializing;                                                                          \
00489         bool RTS_Ip_allow_recursion = (ALLOW_RECURSION);                                                                       \
00490                                                                                                                                \
00491         /* First critical section is only to obtain the initialization status and update it to "initializing" if necessary. We \
00492          * must release the lock before the RTS_I_LOCK body is executed in case we need to handle recursive calls to the       \
00493          * RTS_I_LOCK construct. */                                                                                            \
00494         RTS_MUTEX(MUTEX) {                                                                                                     \
00495             if (!(RTS_Ip_initialized=RTS_Is_initialized) && !(RTS_Ip_initializing=RTS_Is_initializing)) {                      \
00496                 RTS_Is_initializing = true; /* but leave private copy false so we can detect changed state */                  \
00497                 RTS_Is_initializer = pthread_self();                                                                           \
00498             }                                                                                                                  \
00499         } RTS_MUTEX_END;                                                                                                       \
00500                                                                                                                                \
00501         if (!RTS_Ip_initialized) {                                                                                             \
00502             if (!RTS_Ip_initializing) {                                                                                        \
00503                 do { /* so we catch "break" statements in user-supplied code. */                                               \
00504                     try {
00505 
00506 
00508 #  define RTS_INIT_END                                                                                                         \
00509                     } catch (...) {                                                                                            \
00510                         /* If the user supplied body throws an exception, consider the body to have completed. */              \
00511                         RTS_MUTEX(*RTS_Ip_mutex) {                                                                             \
00512                             RTS_Is_initialized = true;                                                                         \
00513                             RTS_Is_initializing = false;                                                                       \
00514                             pthread_cond_broadcast(&RTS_Is_condition);                                                         \
00515                         } RTS_MUTEX_END;                                                                                       \
00516                         throw;                                                                                                 \
00517                     }                                                                                                          \
00518                 } while (0);                                                                                                   \
00519                 RTS_MUTEX(*RTS_Ip_mutex) {                                                                                     \
00520                     RTS_Is_initialized = true;                                                                                 \
00521                     RTS_Is_initializing = false;                                                                               \
00522                     pthread_cond_broadcast(&RTS_Is_condition);                                                                 \
00523                 } RTS_MUTEX_END;                                                                                               \
00524             } else if (pthread_equal(pthread_self(), RTS_Is_initializer)) {                                                    \
00525                 /* This was a recursive call resulting from the user-supplied RTS_I body and we must allow it to continue      \
00526                  * unimpeded to prevent deadlock. We don't need to be holding the MUTEX lock to access RTS_Is_initializer      \
00527                  * because it's initialized only the first time through the critical section above--and the only way to reach  \
00528                  * this point is by this or some other thread having already initialized RTS_Is_initializer. */                \
00529                 if (!RTS_Ip_allow_recursion) {                                                                                 \
00530                     fprintf(stderr, "RTS_I_LOCK body made a recursive call. Aborting...\n");                                   \
00531                     abort();                                                                                                   \
00532                 }                                                                                                              \
00533             } else {                                                                                                           \
00534                 /* This is some other thread which is not in charge of initializing the class, bug which arrived to the        \
00535                  * RTS_I_LOCK before the first thread completed the initialization. */                                         \
00536                 RTS_MUTEX(*RTS_Ip_mutex) {                                                                                     \
00537                     while (!RTS_Is_initialized)                                                                                \
00538                         pthread_cond_wait(&RTS_Is_condition, &(RTS_Ip_mutex->mutex));                                          \
00539                 } RTS_MUTEX_END;                                                                                               \
00540             }                                                                                                                  \
00541         }                                                                                                                      \
00542     } while (0)
00543 #else
00544 #  define RTS_INIT(MUTEX, ALLOW_RECURSION)                                                                                     \
00545     do {                                                                                                                       \
00546         static bool RTS_Is_initialized=false;                                                                                  \
00547         if (!RTS_Is_initialized) {                                                                                             \
00548             RTS_Is_initialized = true;                                                                                         \
00549             do {
00550 #  define RTS_INIT_END                                                                                                         \
00551             } while (0);                                                                                                       \
00552         }                                                                                                                      \
00553     } while (0)
00554 #endif
00555 
00556 #define RTS_INIT_RECURSIVE(MUTEX)       RTS_INIT(MUTEX, true)                   
00557 #define RTS_INIT_NONRECURSIVE(MUTEX)    RTS_INIT(MUTEX, false)

00595     RTS_Message(FILE *f, Prefix *p)
00596         : f(f), p(p), buffer(NULL), bufsz(0), interrupted(false) {

00598     }
00599 
00600     ~RTS_Message() {

00602     }

00606         this->f = f;
00607     }
00608

00612     }

00725     static bool sol;

00728     Prefix *p;                                          
00729     char *buffer;

00731     std::string name;

00772 #ifdef ROSE_THREADS_ENABLED
00773 #  define RTS_MESSAGE(MESG)                                                                                                    \
00774     do {                                                                                                                       \
00775         RTS_Message *RTS_Mp_mesg = &(MESG);                                                                                    \
00776         int RTS_Mp_err = RTS_Mp_mesg->lock();                                                                                  \
00777         assert(0==RTS_Mp_err);                                                                                                 \
00778         do {                                                                                                                   \
00779             try {
00780 
00781 #  define RTS_MESSAGE_END(SOL)                                                                                                 \
00782             } catch (...) {                                                                                                    \
00783                 RTS_Mp_err = RTS_Mp_mesg->unlock((SOL));                                                                       \
00784                 assert(0==RTS_Mp_err);                                                                                         \
00785                 throw;                                                                                                         \
00786             }                                                                                                                  \
00787         } while (0);                                                                                                           \
00788         RTS_Mp_err = RTS_Mp_mesg->unlock((SOL));                                                                               \
00789         assert(0==RTS_Mp_err);                                                                                                 \
00790     } while (0)
00791 #else
00792 #  define RTS_MESSAGE(MESG)                                                                                                    \
00793     do {
00794 #  define RTS_MESSAGE_END(SOL)                                                                                                 \
00795     } while (0)
00796 #endif
